results.name: Smallest positive number starting an interval of consecutive integers with element sum n.
comment: Right border of A299765. - _Omar E. Pol_, Jul 24 2018
In other words: a(n) is smallest part of the partitions of n into consecutive parts. - _Omar E. Pol_, Mar 12 2019
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..20000 (first 1000 terms from Paul D. Hanna)
formula: a(m) = 2 iff m = k*(k+3)/2: a(A000096(n)) = 2. - _Bernard Schott_, Mar 12 2019
maple: a:= proc(n) local j, k, s; j, k, s:= 1$3;
if s<n then k:= k+1; s:= s+k
else s:= s-j; j:= j+1 fi
mathematica: a[n_] := Module[{j = 1, k = 1, s = 1}, While[True, If[s == n, Break[]]; If[s < n, k = k+1; s = s+k, s = s-j; j = j+1]]; j];
Array[a, 100] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Mar 12 2019, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
